title: Large Bowl with Beveled Internal Rim
description:
One diorite hemispherical bowl.
Condition:  Some superficial cracking seen inside and out. Some iron salt staining on the inside.

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.78E
labels.content: These finely crafted objects demonstrate the mastery of stoneworking in the Early Dynastic Period. An artisan fitted the two parts of the alabaster jar together. The other three pieces were created by grinding and drilling the extremely hard stone and then polishing it with abrasives.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

images.caption: Large Bowl with Beveled Internal Rim, ca. 2800-2675 B.C.E. Anorthosite gneiss or diorite, 5 7/8 x Diam. 12 5/8 in. (15 x 32 cm). Brooklyn Museum, Charles Edwin Wilbour Fund, 37.78E. Creative Commons-BY (Photo: Brooklyn Museum, CUR.37.78E_erg3.jpg)
